question.body: When considering the trunk as the origin, the knee would be considered _______ to the ankle.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Superficial is the opposite of deep and is used in reference to an outer surface, such as that of the body or organ.
Incorrect. Your answer is close in orientation, but the opposite direction.
Correct. The knee is nearer the trunk (origin) than the ankle, making it proximal.
Incorrect. The knee is nearer the trunk (origin) than the ankle, so the answer is the opposite of distal.

part.hint: Remember that that depending on the origin, the answers could differ, so keep in mind that the starting position is the trunk.
